isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SPICER 15-1/2 INCH (394 MM) SOLO™ CLUTCH - INSTALL - TRANSMISSION

note.para: Check wear on clutch release yoke fingers, cross shaft and cross shaft bushings. Replace if necessary.
Lubricate the release bearing housing and wear pads, and cross shaft bushings prior to installing the transmission. Refer to LUBRICATION.

step1.para: Shift the transmission into gear so the main drive gear can be rotated during installation to line up the driven disc splines with the transmission input shaft splines.
Use a sling or transmission jack to support and align the transmission with the engine.

caution.para: Do not let the transmission drop or hang unsupported in the driven discs.

step1.para: Rotate the clutch release yoke rearward and center the yoke on the drive gear bearing cap. Hold the yoke in this position. Start the input shaft into the clutch release bearing sleeve. Slide the transmission forward to pick up the driven disc splines. It might be necessary to rotate the transmission output shaft to align the input shaft with the driven disc splines ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Align Input Shaft with Driven Disc Splines

step1.para: When the clutch release yoke fingers pass over the release bearing assembly thrust pads, turn the release shaft to swing the release yoke fingers down in front of the release bearing thrust pads ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Turn Release Shaft to Swing Release Yoke Fingers Down

note.para: Interference of the release yoke fingers with the clutch cover assembly will prevent installation of the transmission or cause binding of the release shaft if it is not rotated.

step1.para: Engage the clutch housing pilot into the flywheel housing and align the bolt holes. Start all bolts and tighten progressively around the housing.

Adjust the linkage until the fingers of the release yoke contact the release bearing wear pads. Refer to Group 11- Linkage in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the model being serviced. There will be zero free play at the clutch pedal when this step is completed ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Zero Free Play at Clutch Pedal

step1.para: Fully depress the clutch pedal a minimum of 5 times to set the clutch and gain free play at the clutch pedal.
